name: Argyll
descriptions: Argyll is the doctor for the Boomers living at the Nellis Air Force Base in 2281.

He is a doctor for the Boomers at Nellis Air Force Base and can usually be found inside the Nellis medical station. He treats small ailments such as bug bites but also treats more life-threatening conditions.
He will not heal or sell medical supplies to the player character before they have helped the Boomers enough or healed at least two of his patients.
Area designer Robert Lee implemented Argyll and the objective to heal the injured Boomers in the medical station.

PC Xbox 360 Argyll can spontaneously start a fight with Lily, Rex or ED-E for no apparent reason. This occurred after finishing patient treatment dialogue. This is most likely a result of the non-human companions having consumables bug.
detailed_location: Nellis medical station,Nellis Air Force Base

topics.response_text: I know Mother Pearl is letting you wander Nellis as you please, Outsider, but I have patients to tend to.
Are you sure you know what you're doing? You nearly killed that man!
Excellent treatment. I hadn't thought of that!
Excellent treatment. I hadn't thought of that!
Now I know what they mean by "dumb luck"!
Hold it right there! You had no business treating that man. You may've spared him a lingering death, but that's straight-out malpractice.

topics.topic_text: Can you spare any medical supplies?
topics.response_text: You've done right by us, so I suppose I could spare some supplies.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry, I don't know enough to help. I wish I did.
topics.response_text: Don't apologize. Their care is my responsibility, but everything I know came from an old first aid field manual.

topics.topic_text: I have extensive medical knowledge. Let's see what I can do.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] If what you say is true, you can do us a world of good.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> I'm a medical expert and my specialty is giant insect bites!
topics.response_text: [FAILED] These patients were gravely injured. It's not a joking matter!

topics.topic_text: <Lie> I assume the ants' tibular nastis pierced the patients' anterior traxes?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Well... I don't know, actually... I suppose it's possible. You should take a look!

topics.topic_text: I have wounds that need mending.
topics.response_text: I can patch you up in exchange for doses of Fixer.

topics.topic_text: I need help with an addiction.
topics.response_text: I can unburden you of that in exchange for doses of Rad-Away.
I can help you in exchange for Stimpaks.

topics.topic_text: All right. Here's three doses of Fixer.
topics.response_text: You're going to feel a little pinch.{[DUPLICATE LINE?]}
Fair enough.
Hold still. This'll burn for a moment.
The symptoms of withdrawal will pass with time.
This'll make you feel better.
Well, try to avoid further exposure.

topics.topic_text: All right. Here's two doses of Fixer.
topics.response_text: You're going to feel a little pinch.
Hold still. This'll burn for a moment.
This'll make you feel better.{[DUPLICATE LINE?]}

topics.topic_text: I'm still looking for ways to make myself useful.
topics.response_text: Well, look elsewhere. I can't let you near a patient after what happened.
Seeing as you're a friend of ours, I suppose we could trade for what you need.
Goodbye.

conversation.response_text: Got yourself cut up pretty good, eh?
